fullText: The show is a technical marvel that dazzles the eye, but its emotional core remains frustratingly hollow.
dtliExcerpt: The show is a technical marvel that dazzles the eye, but its emotional core remains frustratingly hollow.
bwwExcerpt: To quote the title of an R&B hit by early '70s girl group Honey Cone, 'One Monkey Don't Stop No Show.' Except that in King Kong, it most definitely does. In fact, that monstrous ape, able to cup an aspiring Hollywood starlet in one giant paw, pretty much is the show in this otherwise blundering musical, in which a low-wattage cast gamely trudges through one embarrassing number or clich√©-ridden book scene after another. Even if the star puppet might be better suited for an arena spectacle or theme-park attraction, you can't take your eyes off this technological marvel, not least for its incredible facial expressiveness. It's completely appropriate that the animatronic gorilla and its operators get the show's final bow.
